name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-Bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone has two phenyl groups, which would each add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Each phenyl group also introduces two amino groups, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, adding about +10 due to the increase in molecular weight and the capacity for hydrogen bonding. The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) may also add roughly +20 due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact.
